recommendations.title: Ensure the S3 bucket ACL does not grant 'Everyone' READ permission [list S3 objects]
Ensure the S3 bucket ACL does not grant 'Everyone' WRITE permission [create, overwrite, and delete S3 objects]
Ensure the S3 bucket ACL does not grant 'Everyone' READ_ACP permission [read bucket ACL]
Ensure the S3 bucket ACL does not grant 'Everyone' WRITE_ACP permission [modify bucket ACL]
Ensure the S3 bucket ACL does not grant 'Everyone' FULL_CONTROL [READ, WRITE, READ_ACP, WRITE_ACP]
Ensure the S3 bucket ACL does not grant AWS users READ permission [list S3 objects]
Ensure the S3 bucket ACL does not grant AWS users WRITE permission [create, overwrite, and delete S3 objects]
Ensure the S3 bucket ACL does not grant AWS users READ_ACP permission [read bucket ACL]
Ensure the S3 bucket ACL does not grant AWS users WRITE_ACP permission [modify bucket ACL]
Ensure the S3 bucket ACL does not grant AWS users FULL_CONTROL [READ, WRITE, READ_ACP, WRITE_ACP]
Ensure the attached S3 bucket policy does not grant 'Allow' permission to everyone
Ensure the S3 bucket requires MFA to delete objects
Ensure the S3 bucket has access logging enabled
Ensure all data stored in the S3 bucket is securely encrypted at rest
Ensure all data is transported from the S3 bucket securely
Ensure the S3 bucket has versioning enabled
Ensure the S3 bucket access is restricted to a whitelist of IP networks.
Ensure the attached S3 bucket policy does not grant global 'Get' permission.
Ensure the attached S3 bucket policy does not grant global 'Delete' permission.
Ensure the attached S3 bucket policy does not grant global 'List' permission.
Ensure the attached S3 bucket policy does not grant global 'Put' permission.
Avoid the use of the "root" account
Ensure multi-factor authentication (MFA) is enabled for all IAM users that have a console password
Ensure credentials unused for 90 days or greater are disabled
Ensure access keys are rotated every 90 days or less
Ensure IAM password policy requires at least one uppercase letter
Ensure IAM password policy require at least one lowercase letter
Ensure IAM password policy require at least one symbol
Ensure IAM password policy require at least one number
Ensure IAM password policy requires minimum length of 14 or greater
Ensure IAM password policy prevents password reuse
Ensure IAM password policy expires passwords within 90 days or less
Ensure no root account access key exists
Ensure MFA is enabled for the "root" account
Ensure hardware MFA is enabled for the "root" account
Ensure security questions are registered in the AWS account
Ensure IAM policies are attached only to groups or roles
Enable detailed billing
Maintain current contact details
Ensure security contact information is registered
Ensure IAM instance roles are used for AWS resource access from instances
Ensure a support role has been created to manage incidents with AWS Support
Do not setup access keys during initial user setup for all IAM users that have a console password
Ensure IAM policies that allow full "*:*" administrative privileges are not created
Ensure access keys are rotated every 30 days or less
Ensure access keys are rotated every 45 days or less
Ensure public ssh keys are rotated every 30 days or less
Ensure public ssh keys are rotated every 45 days or less
Ensure public ssh keys are rotated every 90 days or less
Ensure active access keys are used every 90 days or less
Iam user should not be inactive from last 30 days or more
Ensure IAM configuration has valid Identity Providers configuration
Ensure IAM Role restrict access to a list of whitelist of IP networks
Ensure IAM User restrict access to a list of whitelist of IP networks
Ensure non-root user exists in the account
Ensure access keys are rotated every 350 days or less
Ensure access keys are rotated every 180 days or less
No IAM users with password-based console access should exist
Ensure CloudTrail is enabled in all regions
Ensure CloudTrail log file validation is enabled
Ensure S3 bucket CloudTrail logs is not publicly accessible
Ensure CloudTrail is integrated with CloudWatch Logs
Ensure AWS Config is enabled in all regions
Ensure S3 bucket access logging is enabled on the CloudTrail S3 bucket
Ensure CloudTrail logs are encrypted at rest using KMS CMKs
Ensure rotation for customer created CMKs is enabled
Ensure Flow Logging for VPC is enabled and active
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for Management Console sign-in without MFA
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for usage of "root" account
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for IAM policy changes
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for CloudTrail configuration changes
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for AWS Management Console authentication failures
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for disabling or scheduled deletion of customer created CMKs
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for S3 bucket policy changes
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for AWS Config configuration changes
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for security group changes
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for changes to Network Access Control Lists (NACL)
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for changes to network gateways
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for route table changes
Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for VPC changes
Ensure appropriate subscribers to each SNS topic
Ensure no security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22
Ensure no security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 3389
Ensure the default security group of every VPC restricts all traffic
Ensure routing tables for VPC peering are "least access"
Security groups are not attached to an in-use network interface
Network ACLs do not allow unrestricted inbound traffic
Network ACLs do not allow unrestricted outbound traffic
AWS VPC endpoints should not be exposed
Security Group should not be open to all(unrestricted)
Security Group should not accept traffic other than 80 and 443
Unrestricted Security Group should not be attached to EC2 instance
Unrestricted Security Group should not be attached to RDS database
Unrestricted Security Group should not be attached to Network Interface
Unrestricted Security Group should not be attached to Classical Load Balancer
Unrestricted Security Group should not be attached to Application Load Balancer
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 9300 (Elasticsearch)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 5601 (Kibana)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 6379 (Redis)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 2379 (etcd)
ELB SSL Certificate expires in 5 Days
ELB SSL Certificate expires in 45 Days
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 23 (Telnet)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 135 (Windows RPC)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 445 (Windows SMB)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 3306 (MySQL)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 5432 (PostgreSQL)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 1433 (SQLServer)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to UDP port 1434 (SQLServer)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 4333 (MSQL)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 5500 (VNC Listener)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 5900 (VNC Server)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to UDP port 137 (NetBIOS)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to UDP port 138 (NetBIOS)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to UDP port 445 (CIFS)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 21 (FTP)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 20 (FTP-Data)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 25 (SMTP)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 53 (DNS)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to UDP port 53 (DNS)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to All Ports
Redshift Cluster should not be Publicly Accessible
ELB Security Group should have Outbound Rules attached to it
ELB should not use insecure Cipher(s)
EC2 instance should be deployed in EC2-VPC platform
CloudFront Origin Protocol Policy should use https-only
CloudFront Origin SSL Protocols should not use insecure Cipher(s)
Security group should not allow inbound traffic from all to all ICMP
ELB should have VPC ingress security group
Classic LBs should have a valid and secure security group
No Default VPC should be present in an AWS account
EC2 instances should not have a Public IP address attached
Attached VPC CIDR block(s) should be in whitelist
Load Balancers should have Access Logs enabled
CloudFront View Protocol Policy should use https-only
ELBs should have a valid and secure security group
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 27017 (MongoDB)
Security group attached to EC2 instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 27018 (MongoDB)
Security group attached to Elastic Load Balancer instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 27017 (MongoDB)
Security group attached to Elastic Load Balancer instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 27018 (MongoDB)
Security group attached to Application Load Balancer instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 27017 (MongoDB)
Security group attached to Application Load Balancer instance should not allow inbound traffic from all to TCP port 27018 (MongoDB)
Ec2 instance does not have any tags
Ensure EBS Volumes are Encrypted
Ensure No Public EBS Snapshots
Ensure RDS database is encrypted with customer managed KMS key
Ensure Redshift Cluster is encrypted
Ensure no server certificate has been uploaded before Heartbleed vulnerability
Ensure ELB has latest Secure Cipher policies Configured for Session Encryption
Ensure ELB is not affected by POODLE Vulnerability (CVE-2014-3566)
Lambda Function should not have Admin Privileges
Lambda Function should not have Cross Account Access
Lambda Function should not have Same IAM Role for more than one lambda function
Lambda Function should have tracing enabled
Lambda Function should not have VPC access
RDS should not have a Public Interface
Elastic Search Domain should not be exposed
Elastic Search Domain should be in a VPC
Elastic Search Domain should not have EncryptionAtRest disabled
Elastic Search Domain should not have Encryption using AWS Managed Keys

reportTitle: AWS CIS Benchmark and S3 Report
